metadata.title: A clinical pilot study on overdentures retained by two unsplinted narrow-diameter implants– oral health-related quality of life and masticatory function

abstract.first_50_chars: Purpose This prospective clinical pilot study aime
abstract.last_50_chars: ed quality of life, Chewing, Masticatory function

introduction.heading: Introduction
introduction.first_sentence: Prosthetic restorations aim to restore function and aesthetics, with patient satisfaction being a key priority.
introduction.first_100_chars: Prosthetic restorations aim to restore function and aesthetics, with patient satisfaction being a ke
introduction.last_sentence: This publication presents secondary outcome data, including OHIP-G14 [24] scores, subjective masticatory ability, and standardized masticatory function test results.
introduction.last_100_chars: G14 [24] scores, subjective masticatory ability, and standardized masticatory function test results.

discussion.heading: Discussion
discussion.first_sentence: This clinical pilot study evaluated two diameter-reduced titanium-zirconia implants with overdentures in edentulous jaws, assessing OHRQoL and masticatory function.
discussion.first_100_chars: This clinical pilot study evaluated two diameter-reduced titanium-zirconia implants with overdenture
discussion.last_sentence: Future larger studies are necessary to validate these findings and further explore the impact of implant-supported prostheses on OHRQoL and masticatory function.
discussion.last_100_chars: s and further explore the impact of implant-supported prostheses on OHRQoL and masticatory function.

However, in Fonteyne et al. [13] only six of 21 patients
The limitations of the present study have already been

conclusions.heading: Conclusions
conclusions.first_sentence: Treatment with two implants and an overdenture in the maxilla and mandible significantly improved OHRQoL, perceived masticatory function, and objective masticatory performance compared to conventional complete dentures.
conclusions.first_100_chars: Treatment with two implants and an overdenture in the maxilla and mandible significantly improved OH
conclusions.last_sentence: However, this study does not provide evidence that additional maxillary implants yield significantly greater improvements in OHRQoL and masticatory function compared to mandibular treatment alone.
conclusions.last_100_chars: ntly greater improvements in OHRQoL and masticatory function compared to mandibular treatment alone.
